reporting-org.narrative: European Commission - DG Neighbourhood and Enlargement Negotiations

title.narrative: Enhancing Access to Non Communicable Diseases and Mental Health Services at the level of Primary Health Care for Vulnerable Syrian refugees and Lebanese communities in Lebanon Response to the Syrian crisis

description.narrative: GO: to reduce morbidity and mortality due to non-communicable diseases including mental health among vulnerable Syrian refugees and Lebanese communities. SO1.To guarantee continued access to non-communicable diseases care of 43,000 Syrian and Lebanese patients and access to mental health care and psychosocial support of 25,000 SY and LB patients in 460 selected PHCCs. SO2.To enhance capacities of MoPH in monitor mental health conditions, services and referral from primary care. SO3. To improve c

description.narrative: Reported results indicators by the European Commission ¿ International Cooperation and Development (DEVCO) may not represent the complete set of indicators monitored for the project. The results are reported using a contribution approach. This means that where a project has been financed by the EU jointly with other funders ¿ such as partner country governments or other donors ¿ the overall outputs of the collective effort are reported rather than outputs attributed to the share of funding provided by the EU. For higher levels of results, such as outcomes and impacts, the project will only have contributed to the overall effort.
